== Build your own ==

The source files I used to build the package are in [http://code.google.com/p/git-osx-installer/source/browse svn trunk] (I used !PackageMaker).  You may want to check that out and open it up and explore to get an idea of how to build a package, if you've never done it before :) (You may need to install my package first, as !PackageMaker may not show references to non-existing files)

Some guidelines steps:

 * Use this [http://git-osx-installer.googlecode.com/svn/trunk/BuildInstructions.txt build recipe] to build git
 * Open up !PackageMaker
 * Add the folder /usr/local/git to package contents (use the Add Contents context menu when ctrl-clicking on the contents sidebar).  
 
Choice Name: Git 1.5.4.5 (or the version of git). 

Description:
{{{
Installs Git and dependencies to /usr/local/git/
}}}

* Then, select the folder that appears.
http://git-osx-installer.googlecode.com/files/Git-option-configuration.jpg


   * De-select the man pages folder:
http://git-osx-installer.googlecode.com/files/Git-option-contents.jpg

   * Make sure the files in the "hooks" directory are set to install as non-executable: 
http://git-osx-installer.googlecode.com/files/git-option-contents-hooks-non-executable.jpg
 
    * Under components, disable "Allow Relocation"

 * Add the "Man Pages" package contents from /usr/local/git/man, and configure it accordingly:

Choice Name: Man Pages

Text:
{{{
  Documentation for Git.  Recommended.
}}}

http://git-osx-installer.googlecode.com/files/git-man-configuration.jpg

 * Add the [http://git-osx-installer.googlecode.com/svn/trunk/UserScripts UserScripts] folder (you'll need to [http://code.google.com/p/git-osx-installer/source/browse check it out from subversion]) as a package contents

Choice Name: Update MANPATH and PATH

Description:
{{{
Updates your PATH and MANPATH so the git executables are accessible via the command line.  If .profile or .bash_profile exist, it will append to them.  If neither exist, it will create .bash_profile.  Additionally, sets the PATH/MANPATH variables in ~/.MacOSX/environment.plist (so apps like TextMate will see it).  This requires a logout to take affect.
}}}

    * Set it to NOT run as administer, and set the destination to blank.
http://git-osx-installer.googlecode.com/files/userscript-option-configuration-1.jpg
    * Set the POST install script to include add_git_path.sh
http://git-osx-installer.googlecode.com/files/userscript-options-scripts.jpg
  
 * Finally, add the folder /usr/local/git/share/git-gui/lib/Git Gui.app

Choice Name: Git Gui

Description:
{{{
Git Gui is a fully functional graphical interface to git
}}}
    * Run as administrator
    * Under components, disable "Allow Relocation"
